title: Sutton's pie-eating goalkeeper Wayne Shaw's colourful past including headbutting a supporter
text:
Would Sutton goalkeeper Wayne transfer to Arsenal? Share this video Watch Next Read More Sutton's roly poly goalie Wayne Shaw facing FA betting probe after eating pie during Arsenal game Controversial row with fan 
The reserve goalkeeper caused controversy back in 2013 when he confronted a Kingstonian fan during his warm up. 
The fan had been berating him for his weight, leading Shaw to leap over the advertising hoardings to headbutt the fan, which Shaw puts down to 'a bad day at work.' 
It resulted in Shaw being sacked by Sutton, though he made a quick return a year later after a short stint with Gosport Borough and has juggled several roles at the club ever since. Wayne Shaw on 'Good Morning Britain' (Photo: Rex Features) Bright prospect 
Shaw was actually a striker starting out - and a pretty good one at that with time spent in Southampton's youth sides. 
Having failed to make it at The Dell, Shaw dropped down the divisions and bounced from club to club. 
First it was an apprenticeship with Reading, then a move to Basingstoke and a loan with Bashley, where his life-changing switch of positions occurred. 
"One day they had a goalkeeping dilemma and the manager said I had to buy a pair of gloves," Shaw told the Mail. "We beat Salisbury 1-0 and I've been in goal ever since." Wayne Shaw talks to former goalkeeper Mark Schwarzer (Photo: Getty Images) Read More Alan Shearer jokes about time together 
Alan Shearer has confirmed the two once shared the dressing room as youth team players for Saints. 
The former England striker joked that both followed their dreams - just that Shaw's was less conventional. 
"He did (play in the same team as me), absolutely. When we were 14 or 15," said Shearer before Sutton took on Arsenal in the FA Cup. 
"I actually followed my dreams to the Premier League, and he followed his to the burger van, I think." Alan Shearer and Wayne Shaw together as young players at Southampton (Photo: BBC) Utility man 
While Shaw is known for being a member of the squad, he does various other jobs at the club, including sweeping the 3G pitch at Gander Green Lane and helping with coaching. 
Shaw is at the club from Monday to Thursday before returning back to his home on the south coast. 
"I have to turn off the floodlights each night at about 10pm so I sleep here on the couch on Mondays, Tuesdays and Wednesdays," Shaw revealed. Wayne Shaw the Sutton reserve goalkeeper hovers the away dugout (Photo: GETTY) Naked modelling? 
What does the future hold for Shaw now, then? Well, one particular offer has come from a publication asking him to pose nude. 
"A publication asked if they can photograph me naked," Shaw confirmed. "Like, everything off, except a pair of goalie gloves, apparently. They said they'll position me in a way that covers me up, if you know what I mean." 
Quite whether he will accept the offer is unclear, for now Shaw will revel in his newfound fame as Sutton begin to move on from their FA Cup fairytale. Like us on Facebook
